issue.title: OBS Studio Crashes on Arch Linux after selecting screen (pipewire)

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Operating System Info

Other

### Other OS

Arch Linux

### OBS Studio Version

29.1.3

### OBS Studio Version (Other)

_No response_

### OBS Studio Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/WKUljs7PfSQdNJ9W

### OBS Studio Crash Log URL

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

Full screen recording on selected monitor.

### Current Behavior

Crashes immediately after selecting a screen with pipewire on Hyprland/Wayland.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open OBS Studio
2. Add pipewire as a source
3. Select a screen
4. Crash
...


### Anything else we should know?

Worked everything before the current full Arch Linux update. Maybe something in combination of OBS Studio and pipewire?
Using Hyprland on Wayland with pipewire 0.3.80

body: Possibly related to https://github.com/hyprwm/xdg-desktop-portal-hyprland/issues/112 (where the maintainer suggests it's likely an obs issue).

I can confirm I'm having the same issue on Gentoo Linux. The crash occurs when I go to select "Screen Capture (Pipewire)" in the sources tab. It then prompts me to select which monitor I want to share. As soon as I select the monitor to share, obs SEGFAULTS.

Full backtrace log provided below

## **Info**
**OS** ----------------------- Gentoo 2.14 x86_64
**Kernel** ----------------- 6.1.57-gentoo-dist
**Window Manager** - Sway 1.8.1
**CPU** --------------------- AMD Ryzen 9 5950X (32) @ 5.08GHz
**GPU** ---------------------AMD Radeon RX 6750 XT

## **Packages**
**OBS** ------------------------------ media-video/obs-studio 29.1.3-r1
**Pipewire** ----------------------- media-video/pipewire 0.3.80
**xdg-desktop-portal** ------- sys-apps/xdg-desktop-portal 1.16.0-r1
**xdg-desktop-portal-wlr** - gui-libs/xdg-desktop-portal-wlr 0.5.0
**xdg-desktop-portal-gtk** - sys-apps/xdg-desktop-portal-gtk 1.14.1

issue.title: black screen capture on wayland (swaywm, nvidia, gentoo)

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Operating System Info

Other

### Other OS

Gentoo

### OBS Studio Version

29.1.3

### OBS Studio Version (Other)

_No response_

### OBS Studio Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/lObQWdzHmyH6Back

### OBS Studio Crash Log URL

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

When using a pipewire screen capture, it should be able to record videos.

### Current Behavior

The output is black, with an `error: [pipewire] Error id:2 seq:10 res:-32 (Unknown error -32): no more input formats` error
This occurs when using the nvidia gpu (with `prime-run`) but i haven't been able to test on the integrated amd gpu because of #9733

### Steps to Reproduce

1. launch obs with `prime-run obs`
2. create a `Screen Capture (PipeWire)` input
3. black screen, even after selecting the monitor to record
...


### Anything else we should know?

I did setup everything right for screen capture on my side, as can be proven both by
1. trying screen capture on firefox (works)
2. trying the [xdp-screen-cast.py](https://gitlab.gnome.org/-/snippets/19) script (also works)

body:
if your stack has `#1  0x00007fff8c1841b8 in swap_texture_red_blue (texture=0x7fff6014fe20)` this is a duplicate already fixed issue. Please only provide stacks from current master obs, always include the commit id you have tested on.

And ensure your stacks have symbols and lines , stacks without debug symbols are not going to be helpful in identifying if there are any other additional issues than what was originally reported.

I emerged the 9999 ebuild versions of obs and pipewire, and now it no longer crashes when sharing screens. However, when I go to share the screen, the red and blue channels seem to be swapped. 
![obsColorsSwapped](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/assets/12601671/03dc1f8d-31ce-439e-9b34-69a9c3c4a367)

The obs logs says the negotiated format was Spa:Enum:VideoFormat:RGBX

```
info: [pipewire] Asking for desktop
info: [pipewire] desktop selected, setting up screencast
info: [pipewire] Server version: 0.3.83
info: [pipewire] Library version: 0.3.83
info: [pipewire] Header version: 0.3.80
info: [pipewire] Created stream 0x55632c8b1e60
info: [pipewire] Stream 0x55632c8b1e60 state: "connecting" (error: none)
info: [pipewire] Playing stream 0x55632c8b1e60
info: [pipewire] Stream 0x55632c8b1e60 state: "paused" (error: none)
info: [pipewire] Negotiated format:
info: [pipewire]     Format: 7 (Spa:Enum:VideoFormat:RGBx)
info: [pipewire]     Size: 2560x1440
info: [pipewire]     Framerate: 0/1
info: [pipewire] Stream 0x55632c8b1e60 state: "streaming" (error: none)
```

I can create a separate issue for this, since it no longer seems relevant to the problem in this issue

> I can create a separate issue for this, since it no longer seems relevant to the problem in this issue

~~Yes please create another issue for this.~~ I already have a fix pending for this so no need for an issue.
I was able to replicate this.

issue.title: linux-pipewire: Use the format properties for swap r/b

labels.name: Bug Fix
labels.description: Non-breaking change which fixes an issue

milestone.title: OBS Studio 30.0
milestone.description:
Items that we would like to consider for inclusion in OBS Studio 30.0.

NOTE: Items on this list are not promised to be in the listed release, just that we are considering them. This list is subject to change at any time.

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
<!--- Please fill out the following template, which will help other contributors review your Pull Request. -->

<!--- Make sure youve read the contribution guidelines here: https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst -->

### Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail. -->
<!--- If this change includes UI elements, please include screenshots. -->
We refactored this data to be part of the format properties instead of an out parameter. But forgot to start using this field instead.


### Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open GitHub Issue, or implements feature request -->
<!--- from the Ideas page, please link to the issue here. -->
Fixes comments here https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/issues/9733#issuecomment-1773900272

### How Has This Been Tested?
<!--- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes. -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment (hardware, OS version, etc.),-->
<!--- and the tests you ran, including how it may affect other areas of code. -->
Both `RGBx` and `BGRx` render correctly on my machine now.

### Types of changes
<!--- What types of changes does your PR introduce? Uncomment all that apply -->
- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
<!--- - New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) -->
<!--- - Tweak (non-breaking change to improve existing functionality) -->
<!--- - Performance enhancement (non-breaking change which improves efficiency) -->
<!--- - Code cleanup (non-breaking change which makes code smaller or more readable) -->
<!--- - Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change) -->
<!--- - Documentation (a change to documentation pages) -->

### Checklist:
<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] My code has been run through [clang-format](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/.clang-format).
- [x] I have read the [**contributing** document](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).
- [x] My code is not on the master branch.
- [x] The code has been tested.
- [x] All commit messages are properly formatted and commits squashed where appropriate.
- [x] I have included updates to all appropriate documentation.

issue.title: linux-pipewire: Load glad symbols on start

labels.name: Bug Fix
labels.description: Non-breaking change which fixes an issue

milestone.title: OBS Studio 30.0
milestone.description:
Items that we would like to consider for inclusion in OBS Studio 30.0.

NOTE: Items on this list are not promised to be in the listed release, just that we are considering them. This list is subject to change at any time.

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail. -->
<!--- If this change includes UI elements, please include screenshots. -->
After the cmake 3.0 rebuild glad was transitioned to a static library. This lead to the glad symbols being uninitialized and crashes when they are used in some cases.


### Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open GitHub Issue, or implements feature request -->
<!--- from the Ideas page, please link to the issue here. -->

fixes shm capture for compositors that dont support dmabuf.

### How Has This Been Tested?
<!--- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes. -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment (hardware, OS version, etc.),-->
<!--- and the tests you ran, including how it may affect other areas of code. -->
Loading with software gl no longer crashes when calling glBindTexture.

### Types of changes
<!--- What types of changes does your PR introduce? Uncomment all that apply -->
- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
<!--- - New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) -->
<!--- - Tweak (non-breaking change to improve existing functionality) -->
<!--- - Performance enhancement (non-breaking change which improves efficiency) -->
<!--- - Code cleanup (non-breaking change which makes code smaller or more readable) -->
<!--- - Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change) -->
<!--- - Documentation (a change to documentation pages) -->

### Checklist:
<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->

body: Ok actually it was probably a different issue, but if you can try the glad symbols change and see if it fixes anything that would help.

### Update

So I tried reemerging the 9999 ebuilds of obs-studio and pipewire to test out the new commits, and I'm now getting the SEGFAULT again when selecting a monitor to share. What's interesting is that the backtrace shows that the segfault is occurring at the "swap_texture_red_blue" function. Except now it's SEGFAULTing on the 9999 builds, even though this should already be a fixed issue.

Pipewire commit - 920beea3
OBS Studio commit - 454fc55

## Console Log

> Ok actually it was probably a different issue, but if you can try the glad symbols change and see if it fixes anything that would help.

I'm traveling for most of this week, but will give it a try once I have a chance, thanks!

> Ok actually it was probably a different issue, but if you can try the glad symbols change and see if it fixes anything that would help.

I was able to build the [kkartaltepe:pipewire-load-gl](https://github.com/kkartaltepe/obs-studio/tree/pipewire-load-gl) version of obs, and it seems to have fixed the crashing issue. It still had the "red and blue channels swapped" issue, but that was fixed after I applied the changes you made here https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/pull/9743#issue-1955667467, which looks to already be merged into master. OBS seemed to function normally now, and I was able to record my desktop with no issues 
![working pipewire capture](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/assets/12601671/f39b5106-2990-4932-a357-627ae81e7fb5)
@jonhoo could you retry whether this still happens on latest master (as of today)?
Should have a chance to test it this weekend!

Just tested screensharing on latest master and it did not work for me either. Obs was still crashing.

I am on the newest Hyprland and xdg-desktop-portal-hyprland commit on Arch. Pipewire is also on the latest version from the Arch repo.

> @jonhoo could you retry whether this still happens on latest master (as of today)?
